scripts.build-raw: REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT=`git rev-parse --short HEAD` REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT_DATE=`git show -s --format=%ci HEAD` react-scripts build # run a regular build in the context of an env that's already been set; WARNING build-raw and start-raw each separately define the computation of env vars REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT and REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT_DATE, and these must be identical in both places
scripts.build:dev: yarn env-cmd -e dev yarn build-raw # run a production build using dev env, eg. with source maps enabled for use with 'yarn analyze'
scripts.build:prod-test: if [ -z "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then npx env-cmd -e prod-test yarn build-raw; else echo 'refusing to run prod-test build with uncommited changes in the working directory'; exit 1; fi
scripts.build:prod: if [ -z "$(git status --porcelain)" ]; then npx env-cmd -e prod npm run build-raw; else echo 'refusing to run production build with uncommited changes in the working directory'; exit 1; fi
scripts.ipfs: yarn build && ipfs-deploy build/ --pinner infura --pinner pinata --dns cloudflare # requires env vars IPFS_DEPLOY_CLOUDFLARE__API_TOKEN, IPFS_DEPLOY_CLOUDFLARE__ZONE, IPFS_DEPLOY_CLOUDFLARE__RECORD, IPFS_DEPLOY_PINATA__API_KEY, IPFS_DEPLOY_PINATA__SECRET_API_KEY
scripts.start-raw: REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT=`git rev-parse --short HEAD` REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT_DATE=`git show -s --format=%ci HEAD` react-scripts start # run dev mode in the context of an env that's already been set; WARNING build-raw and start-raw each separately define the computation of env vars REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT and REACT_APP_GIT_COMMIT_DATE, and these must be identical in both places
